title: Asac
description: Front-end of a appartement rental website built in Typescript, React and Tailwind.
blog_post: I built and designed the front-end of an appartement rental website inspired by Airbnb, showcasing my skills in  implementing front-end design and development. I designed an intuitive and aesthetically pleasing user interface where dynamic information retrieval for listings occurs in real-time on both the homepage and individual property pages. To enhance user experience, I incorporated a search feature, allowing users to quickly and easily find their ideal rental. Additionally, by leveraging React Router, I developed a single-page application (SPA), ensuring smooth and fast navigation between different sections of the site.

title: Rénov à 9
description: Landing Page for a home renovation service, built in Typescript, React, Next.JS and Tailwind.
blog_post: My first work for a client, leveraging technologies such as React, Next.js, and Tailwind CSS.  Next.js was instrumental in providing a robust framework for server-side rendering and static site generation, which significantly improved the page's performance and SEO capabilities. Tailwind CSS was utilized to craft a visually appealing and highly customizable design. These technologies facilitated the creation of a sleek, functional, and user-friendly landing page that effectively showcases the renovation services offered by Renov a 9.

title: Sophie Buel
description: CRUD Application for Architecte, built in vanilla Javascript.
blog_post: I implemented the Front-End and integrated data from an internally developed API using Node.js and Express.js. I worked on making API calls and manipulating the API to set up a authentication system, enabling the retrieval, creation, updating, and deletion of architectural works. Additionally, I  integrated filtering functionalities and an interactive modal to enhance the user experience. This experience strengthened my full-stack development skills, particularly in API management.
